comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: **Dignified Python**: subprocess.run() missing check=True - silent failure on non-zero exit (subprocess.md)

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
False positive: This is an intentional LBYL pattern. Line 83 checks `result.returncode != 0` and returns an error message string for graceful degradation. Adding `check=True` would raise an exception instead of returning the user-friendly error. Per subprocess-wrappers.md: DO NOT migrate check=False LBYL patterns.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-21 18:32 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: **Dignified Python**: subprocess.run() missing check=True - silent failure on non-zero exit (subprocess.md)

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
False positive: This is an intentional LBYL pattern. Line 264 checks `result.returncode != 0` and returns None for graceful degradation. The function docstring says it returns Path or None. Adding check=True would break this contract. Per subprocess-wrappers.md: DO NOT migrate check=False LBYL patterns.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-21 18:32 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: **Dignified Python**: subprocess.run() missing check=True - silent failure on non-zero exit (subprocess.md)

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
False positive: This is a fire-and-forget cleanup operation (deleting session branches after materials are safely on the learn branch). Failure to delete a branch should not block the learn workflow. Per subprocess-wrappers.md graceful degradation section: use this pattern when the operation is optional and has fire-and-forget semantics.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-21 18:32 UTC_
